_header: God almighty save and confirm our king
Note:
Ringler Jr. (1992)
XRingler Jr., William A. Bibliography and Index of English Verse in Manuscript 1501-1558. London: Mansell, 1992; prepared and completed by Michael Rudick and Susan J. Ringler , TM 478; Ringler Jr. (1988)
XRingler Jr., William A. Bibliography and Index of English Verse Printed 1476-1558. London: Mansell, 1988, TP 482; for the original Latin MSS of the Secretum Secretorum, see Singer (1928)
XSinger, Dorothea Waley. Catalogue of Latin and Vernacular Alchemical Manuscripts. 3 vols. Brussels: Lamertin, 1928-31, 1.27-31; for English prose texts compare Oxford, Bodleian Library Ashmole 59 (SC 6943), ff. 1-12v; Ashmole 396, ff. 1-42, Laud Misc. 685, ff. 5-57v, Rawlinson C.83, ff. 1-8; Rawlinson B.490, ff. 28v-72; University College Oxf. 85, pp. 70-135; London, British Library Royal 18 A.VII, ff. 1-26v; London, Lambeth Palace Library 501, ff. 1-42; Singer (1928)
XSinger, Dorothea Waley. Catalogue of Latin and Vernacular Alchemical Manuscripts. 3 vols. Brussels: Lamertin, 1928-31, 29.
_description: John Lydgate and Benedict Burgh, Secrees of old Philisoffres — 390 stanzas rhyme royal

BodAsh46.First Lines:
GOd almyghty save and conserve our kyngIn al vertu to his Encrees
                    of gloryeHis Rewm and hym by polytyk livyngWith dreed and love to haue
                    memorye…
BodAsh46.Last Lines:
…Which the mvt graunte the lord moost ImperialAbove alle
                    hevenys supra celestial
BodAsh46.Note:
On f. 131: ‘Here deyed this translatour and nobyl poete / And the
                    yonge folwere gan his prologe on this wyse’; the second part of the poem,
                    by Benet de Burgh, starts on the next page, f. 131v.

BodAsh59.Transcription:
God allmyghty saue and conserue owre kyngeIn all vertue to hys
                    Encrese off gloryeHys Rewme and hym by polytike levyngeWith drede and
                    loue to haue memoryeOf hys enmyes conquest and victory
BodAsh59.Note: First five lines (Prayer for Henry VI) only; formerly 936.
BodAsh59.Editions:
Robbins,  Rossell Hope. 
             “Popular Prayers in Middle English Verse.” 
             Modern Philology
         36 (1939): 337-50: 341.
Robbins,  Rossell Hope,
                        ed.  
             Historical Poems of the XIV and XV Centuries.
         New York: Columbia UP, 1959: 196.

BodLauMis416.First Lines:
god all mighty saue & conferne our kyngIn all vertu to his
                    encrease of glory…
BodLauMis416.Last Lines:
…Of thyne enemies þou swest as seyne clerkysffor werre
                    shuld be last of thy werkys
BodLauMis416.Attributed Title:
This is the book of the gouernaunce of kyngges and prynces (f.
                    255)
BodLauMis416.Editions:
Robbins,  Rossell Hope. 
             “Popular Prayers in Middle English Verse.” 
             Modern Philology
         36 (1939): 337-50: 341.
Robbins,  Rossell Hope,
                        ed.  
             Historical Poems of the XIV and XV Centuries.
         New York: Columbia UP, 1959: 196.

BodLauMis673.First Lines:
GOd almyghty save & conserme (sic) our kyng In al vertu to his
                    encrees of glorys…
BodLauMis673.Last Lines:
…To that entent I do the forth directeWheer thow faylest that
                    men shal the correcte
BodLauMis673.Attributed Title:
This is the book of the gouernaunce of kynges and of prynces (f.
                    1)

OxfBal329.First Lines:
GOd almyghty saue & conferme owre kyngIn all vertu to hys
                    encrese of glorye…
OxfBal329.Last Lines:
…Wyche þe graunte lorde moste ymperyallA bove all hevyns
                    supra celestyall
OxfBal329.Attributed Title:
Hic incipit tractus De regimine principum (f. 80); Here endyth
                    þe notable tretyse callyd of Arystotyles regimen principum (f.
                    126)

CamGon336.First Lines:
It is to be titelled how preved with oute obstacleAs olde
                    philosopheris put in remembraunce…
CamGon336.Last Lines:
…As arestotel reherseth by wrytyngeIn his pistell to
                    Alisaunder kynge
CamGon336.Note:
Fragment; stanzas 328-31, 353-90, 170-91, 193-4, 195-213, 234-7, 228-33,
                    238-71, 273-89, 64, 43, 65, 68 as noted in Robbins  and  Cutler (1965)
XRossell Hope Robbins,   and  John L. Cutler.  
             Supplement to the Index of Middle English Verse.
         Lexington, Kentucky: University of Kentucky Press, 1965, but
                    treated as whole work: illuminated initial ‘I’ on f. 104, border,
                    etc.; includes four-stanza ‘Verba translatoris’ (ff.
                        123v-124).
CamGon336.Attributed Title:
Of the crafte of phisonomye which trete of the qualitees and Condicions of
                    ich membre of man and of the Image of ypocras whiche Arestotele wrote to kynge
                    Alisaunder (f. 104)

CamFitzMc182.First Lines:
…Of gentiles with grete reuerenceThat he wolde do his
                    deligenceConceive his menynge and hooly þe matereOf his epistill
                    which þat folowith here…
CamFitzMc182.Last Lines:
…Whiche þe mote graunte þe lorde moste imperiallA
                    boue all heuenes supra celestiall
CamFitzMc182.Note: Begins imperfectly at line 65; followed by fragment of 447 used as envoy.

CamFitzMc183.First Lines:
…Bookys recorde an aungel was doun sentffro god aboue brought
                    hym this presentThat he schulde the book reherse canffor his meritys
                    and vertuous dignite…
CamFitzMc183.Last Lines:
…whiche schal cause the haue victoryEnginys to haue is special
                    remedi…
CamFitzMc183.Note:
Begins imperfectly at line 83; leaves missing in middle; ends
                    imperfectly; originally part of London,  British Library Addit. 39922.

CamTCC599.First Lines:
What tyme the season of the yereThe hevynly bawm ascendyng from the
                    Rote…
CamTCC599.Last Lines:
…To owre iiij ages the season well apliedDeth all consumythe
                    whiche may not be denyed Explicit
CamTCC599.Attributed Title:
A tretis of the iiij seasons of the yere that is t[o] say ver Estas
                    Authumnus & yemps (f. 49, by scribe); copieyd by JohnLydgate as aperyeth in
                    his boke of kþe secretis to alysuander from aristotyll (added)
CamTCC599.Facsimiles:
Fletcher,  Bradford Y. 
             “Introduction.” 
             Manuscript Trinity R.3.19. A Facsimile.
         Norman, OK: Pilgrim, 1987. 

Digital Facsimile of Trinity College Cambridge MS R.3.19.
         https://mss-cat.trin.cam.ac.uk/Manuscript/R.3.19.

CamTCC1212.First Lines:
This philesofre famous and notableIn al his dedis prudent &
                    right wise…
CamTCC1212.Last Lines:
…Thi highnesse also for to enhaunceAnd thy magnificence lerne
                    this of me
CamTCC1212.Note:
Lacks stanzas 1-30 and ends imperfectly in the section ‘Of a
                    kyngis Secretaries.’

BLAdd14408.First Lines:
…hym [ ] lyvyng[ ]ede and loue to haue memorie[ ]eue[ ]
                    conquest and victorieWith septyr and swerde betwene bothe to do
                    ryghtaftyr hys lawes to every manere wyght…
BLAdd14408.Last Lines:
…To þat entent I do þe forthe directeWhere þu
                    faylest þat men schall þe correcte
BLAdd14408.Note: Lines 1-3 wanting due to damage to first leaf.

BLAdd34360.First Lines:
[G]Od almyghty save and conferme oure kyngIn al vertu to his
                    encrese and glory…
BLAdd34360.Last Lines:
…Of thyn Enemyes thow owest as seyn the clerkisffor werre
                    shuld be last of thy werkis

BLAdd39922.First Lines:
Ȝyf thow wilt be hool and kepe þe fro siknesseand resiste
                    the strook of pestylence…
BLAdd39922.Last Lines:
…the bryddys syngen in ther armonyesalue that sesoun with
                    sugrid melodie
BLAdd39922.Attributed Title: How aleche schal gouerne aprynce slepyng and wakyng (RT, f. 16)

BLAdd60577.First Lines:
[G]Od almyghti save & conserue oure kyngeIn all vertue to hys
                    encrees of glorye…
BLAdd60577.Last Lines:
…Off good reporte shortly determyneHys sonne of vertues thorow
                    the world shal shyne…
BLAdd60577.Note: Stanzas 1-119, ends incomplete due to missing folios.
BLAdd60577.Attributed Title:
[t]his is the boke of the gouernaunce of kynges and princes (f.
                        24v)
BLAdd60577.Facsimiles:
Wilson,  Edward. 
             “Introduction.” 
             The Winchester Anthology. A Facsimile of British Library Additional
                Manuscript 60577. With an account of the music by 
                    Iain
                    Fenlon. 
         Cambridge: D. S. Brewer, 1981.

BLAru59.First Lines:
GOd almyghti save and conferme oure kyngIn al vertu to his encres
                    and glory…
BLAru59.Last Lines:
…Of thyn Enemyes thow owest as seyn clerkisffor werre shuld be
                    last of thy workis
BLAru59.Note:
In rhyme royal stanzas; the scribe is the so-called ‘Hammond
                    scribe’.

BLHar2251.First Lines:
GOd almyghti save and conferme ouer kyngIn al vertu to his encrese
                    and glory…
BLHar2251.Last Lines:
…Of thyn enemyes thow owest as seyn clerkisffor werre shuld be
                    last of thy werkis
BLHar2251.Attributed Title:
This is the book of the / gouernaunce of kinges / and Prynces (f. 52, in
                    rubric)

BLHar4826.First Lines:
God almyghty save and conferme our kyngIn al vertu to his encrees
                    of glorye…
BLHar4826.Last Lines:
…To that Entent I do the do the forth directeWhere thow
                    faylest that men shal the correcte
BLHar4826.Attributed Title:
This is the book of the gouernance of kynges and Princes (rubricated, f.
                    52)

BLLan285.First Lines:
God almyghty saue and conferme oure kyngIn all vertu to his encrees
                    of glorie…
BLLan285.Last Lines:
…To that intente I doo the foorth directeWhere þu failist
                    that men shall the correct
BLLan285.Attributed Title: This is the book of governaunce of kynges and Princes (f. 152)

BLSl2464.First Lines:
GOd almyghty save and conferme our kyngIn al vertu to his encrees
                    of glory…
BLSl2464.Last Lines:
…To that entent I do the forth directeWher thou fallest that
                    men shal the correcte
BLSl2464.Editions:
Steele,  Robert,
                        ed.  
             Lydgate and Burgh’s Secrees of Old Philisoffres: A version of the
                ‘Secreta Secretorum’.
EETS
         e.s. 66 (1894); repr. 1973.

PierpontM775.First Lines:
…Thorow all Grece manyd lorde and sireAnd bi conquest holde
                    the hool empire…
PierpontM775.Last Lines:
…To that entent I doo the forthe directeWhere thou faylest
                    that men schal the correcte
PierpontM775.Note: Begins imperfectly at end of stanza 7, due to lost folio.

PhilFree304.First Lines:
…ffor decrepitus hath his marke setThis worlde schal ende it
                    may not be lette…
PhilFree304.Last Lines:
…[ ]e eyen dymme the browis were grete[Þ]e nosethrillis
                    shrynke the templis done bete…
PhilFree304.Note:
A single bifolium, not a centerfold, beginning at line 1476; outer third
                    of folio 2 cut away, with some loss of text on f. 2v.
PhilFree304.Attributed Author:
HEre died this translatoure and noble Poete Jon lidgate and the folower
                    began his prologe on this wise (rubric heading to last stanza on f.
                    1)

TokyoTak33.Attributed Title:
Of the crafte of Phisonomye whiche doth trete of the qualitees and
                    condicions of the membre of man and of the Image of ypocras whiche Arestotele
                    wrote to kynge Alisaunder (f. 1)
